lines.text: So, here’s what I’m thinking- whatever burnt up over here had to be really flammable, right?
I guess so. The fire burnt itself out at most fifteen minutes after the alarm went off, before we showed up.
The smoke was mostly clear by then, so it was probably sooner than that.
That’s what I’m saying, yeah. And I think I know what it was that went up in smoke!
Yeah?
Those wires- they were used for binding hay bales! They probably had a bunch stacked in the corner to feed that goat!
Maaaaaa!
Yeah, buddy! I know! Where’d all the food go, right?
Hm. That’d explain why there’s no charcoal or debris in that pile, besides the wires…
Yeah. Alright, then.
But now that we have an idea of what caught fire, and who started it… we still need a why.
A why?
That’s right- did the wizard start the fire <c=#FF00FF>on purpose,</c> or was it <c=#FF00FF>an accident?</c>
...Does it really matter?
You’ve- you know what caused the fire, so why… speculate, about the motives of a dead man?
What, you don’t want to know?
I- I just think it’s a waste of time.
And this is a police investigation. Wastin’ time is practically our chief responsibility.
Figure it out, Seeker.
You got it, boss.
